body_html:
I ran some numbers by unrolling a 100 sequence-length LSTM completely to simulate having a large graph that is autodiff-differentiable (this is probably not a realistic workload, but it will do for now)

metric before after
compileSpec 149ms 279 ms
createAutodiffSubgraphs 91ms 222ms

At some point we should sit down and determine a SLA for what a "fast" or "slow" compilation time for a graph is but in the interest of unblocking mutability let's punt that discussion to the future.

body:
I ran some numbers by unrolling a 100 sequence-length LSTM completely to simulate having a large graph that is autodiff-differentiable (this is probably not a realistic workload, but it will do for now)

| metric | before  | after  |  
|---|---|---|
|  compileSpec | 149ms  | 279 ms | 
|  createAutodiffSubgraphs |  91ms | 222ms |  

At some point we should sit down and determine a SLA for what a "fast" or "slow" compilation time for a graph is but in the interest of unblocking mutability let's punt that discussion to the future.
